Answers here:
  • Partner's name: Nic Baird
  • Budget: 5k max
  • Planner, if applicable: We’ll have a day of coordinator, but otherwise I will be the main point of contact
  • Photographer: Working on it, but hoping for an editorial + documentary approach on film
  • Ceremony design: Outdoors overlooking the ocean, couple to stand, considering guest chairs in more of a circle or otherwise getting creative - we’re not traditional!
  • Wedding party size: No formal wedding party, 50 total guests
  • Cocktail hour/ reception design: Outdoors overlooking the ocean with some high and low tables. Reception indoors in The Solarium overlooking the sunset with all glass walls. Long L shaped table and 2 additional long tables.
  • Color palette and and Pinterest links or inspirational images: We haven’t picked colors yet and would love to collaborate with you to highlight the natural beauty of Sea Ranch with florals. I absolutely love your whimsical + architectural style, and I’m excited to pick flowers together. 
Warmly,
Isa

Hi Isa!! 

Hope you're doing well! Thank you so much for your patience while I've been getting everything lined up for you! 

Here's a little bit about how the associate photographer process works!

- My associate photographers are full time wedding photographers who have a very similar shooting style to me. I spend time with your photographer to make sure they understand the game plan for your day & understand what I am looking for from them! After they photograph your wedding day, all of the files are transferred over to me and I take it over from there! I edit all of the photos and send you your gallery! All of the communication will be done through me, but I make sure to connect the two of you so you will get to know each other as well! 

- With booking me through my associate photographer program I like to gift my couples a free engagement session (all you will have to pay for is travel fees) as a thank you! 

- All film will be included free of charge! 

ALLY RABON PHOTO ASSOCIATE:
Below are a couple of galleries from your associate photographer, Sarah! Feel free to take a look through them and let me know what you think!

    • Talia & Teddy

    • Melanie & Anthony


I have attached an investment guide for you below! Let me know if you have any questions at all! 

Xx Ally

Subject: Wedding Things!
Body:
Hi Mom & Dad! I spoke with Mom briefly about this over the weekend. After inquiring with more than 30 photographers and speaking with 12, Nic & I are most excited by the brother sister team Colin and Lakin. They've been shooting weddings on digital + film for over a decade, are very well-reviewed online, and I've actually been following their work for years because they partner with an up-and-coming wedding dress brand I really like. Here's the good news: They are absolutely lovely humans and obsessed with our vision. Sea Ranch is "at the very top of our bucket list" and they are "so inspired by the architecture and landscapes surrounding the venue." So inspired, in fact, that they *waived all travel and accommodation fees* (they live across the country) and are giving us a *free Super 8 video * plus *free welcome/rehearsal coverage*. The just ok news: Their Photo + Super 8 package is priced at $14k. If you include travel and rehearsal coverage, it would be $16k at minimum. They are only asking us to pay for their base Photo package, which is $8k. That's $1.5-$2k more than our other options, which are $6-$6.5k just for photography with only one shooter (with less talent, if we're being honest). We would LOVE to move forward with them. We get SO much value from that extra $1.5-$2k in both deliverables and, most importantly, quality. It's exactly what I'm looking for, and I honestly never thought we'd have the ability to work with them, but they're bending over backwards to make it work for us financially. Here's some of their work from a recent wedding: Photo , Super 8 . Several photographers I've spoken with are already booked for our date, so now is the time to lock in our vendor of choice. If you are on board, I would love for you to cover photography, 1/3 our costs associated with the venue (~$13k), and truly nothing else. The venue costs are split into 3 payments, one of which Nic & I have already paid, so each family can do one. Lisa is also good with this arrangement & they're happy to cover one pricier vendor as well (probably florals). The rest is all Nic & I, which will be the biggest piece of the pie but I really don't want to ask for anything more. Let me know what you think. Weddings are bonkers! XO, Isabelle
Hi Mom & Dad!

I spoke with Mom briefly about this over the weekend. After inquiring with more than 30 photographers and speaking with 12, Nic & I are most excited by the brother sister team Colin and Lakin. They've been shooting weddings on digital + film for over a decade, are very well-reviewed online, and I've actually been following their work for years because they partner with an up-and-coming wedding dress brand I really like.

Here's the good news: They are absolutely lovely humans and obsessed with our vision. Sea Ranch is "at the very top of our bucket list" and they are "so inspired by the architecture and landscapes surrounding the venue." So inspired, in fact, that they waived all travel and accommodation fees (they live across the country) and are giving us a free Super 8 video plus free welcome/rehearsal coverage.

The just ok news: Their Photo + Super 8 package is priced at $14k. If you include travel and rehearsal coverage, it would be $16k at minimum. They are only asking us to pay for their base Photo package, which is $8k. That's $1.5-$2k more than our other options, which are $6-$6.5k just for photography with only one shooter (with less talent, if we're being honest).

We would LOVE to move forward with them. We get SO much value from that extra $1.5-$2k in both deliverables and, most importantly, quality. It's exactly what I'm looking for, and I honestly never thought we'd have the ability to work with them, but they're bending over backwards to make it work for us financially.

Here's some of their work from a recent wedding: Photo, Super 8. 

Several photographers I've spoken with are already booked for our date, so now is the time to lock in our vendor of choice.

If you are on board, I would love for you to cover photography, 1/3 our costs associated with the venue (~$13k), and truly nothing else. The venue costs are split into 3 payments, one of which Nic & I have already paid, so each family can do one. Lisa is also good with this arrangement & they're happy to cover one pricier vendor as well (probably florals). The rest is all Nic & I, which will be the biggest piece of the pie but I really don't want to ask for anything more.

Let me know what you think. Weddings are bonkers!

XO,
Isabelle

Hi Isabelle,


My name is Amy and I'm with the Talent team here at Sword Health. We’re disrupting the $190B Physical Therapy market, and are backed by top investors like Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, and General Catalyst among others.


I'm reaching out because I love your experience at Humane and we are looking for a Head of Marketing to help us 10x our Women's Health product, Bloom (short video).


Bloom is our fastest growing product and was developed by Sword Health to connect millions of women with innovative pelvic health care from the comfort, convenience, and privacy of home under the belief that physical location should never limit access to clinical-grade care. Bloom includes customized guidance from Pelvic Health Specialists, the Bloom Pod by Elvie, and a mobile app to track real-time results and progress.


Here’s why someone would be excited to join Sword/Bloom now:

    >
  • We raised $400m in B/C/D rounds since 2020 (newest round raised this month)
    • >
  • Bloom has achieved 4.7x YoY growth. To put things in perspective, in January, Bloom alone generated as much revenue in one month as Sword did in the entire year of 2020.
    • >
  • Sword Health is the 26th fastest growing company in the US in this annual Inc. 5000 list!
    • >
  • We had our first profitable month in December 2023
    • >
  • and we just announced the world's first AI Care Specialist, Phoenix (video announcement here), which will support Bloom in the near future as well.
    • >


After just 9 sessions with Bloom, our menopausal women are reporting:

    >
  • 65% improvement on how their pelvic-health symptoms affect their lives
    • >
  • 67% decrease in the likelihood of seeking other healthcare interventions
    • >
  • For women who were already missing work, they reported a 71% reduction in work time missed
    • >
  • 50% reduction in severe depression symptoms
    • >
  • 53% reduction in severe anxiety symptoms
    • >


We all have 3 women in our lives we care deeply about, statistically, at least one of them is likely suffering from a pelvic health disorder. At Bloom, we're dedicated to breaking the silence around these common yet stigmatized issues. Let me know if you'd be open to a having a chat. It would be a pleasure to introduce myself and understand your career goals, what you've been working on at Humane, and possibly bounce this opportunity off of you if it makes sense.


PS - Job description linked here.


Hope to speak soon,

Amy

  • Thursday, 6/20 at 10am or 10:30am PST  
  • Friday, 6/21 at 10am or 10:30am PST 
Let me know! Thank you!

On Jun 12, 2024, at 6:15 AM, Amy Wang Morales <a.wang@swordhealth.com> wrote:

﻿
>

Hi Isabelle,


My name is Amy and I'm with the Talent team here at Sword Health. We’re disrupting the $190B Physical Therapy market, and are backed by top investors like Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, and General Catalyst among others.


I'm reaching out because I love your experience at Humane and we are looking for a Head of Marketing to help us 10x our Women's Health product, Bloom (short video).


Bloom is our fastest growing product and was developed by Sword Health to connect millions of women with innovative pelvic health care from the comfort, convenience, and privacy of home under the belief that physical location should never limit access to clinical-grade care. Bloom includes customized guidance from Pelvic Health Specialists, the Bloom Pod by Elvie, and a mobile app to track real-time results and progress.


Here’s why someone would be excited to join Sword/Bloom now:

    >
  • We raised $400m in B/C/D rounds since 2020 (newest round raised this month)
    • >
  • Bloom has achieved 4.7x YoY growth. To put things in perspective, in January, Bloom alone generated as much revenue in one month as Sword did in the entire year of 2020.
    • >
  • Sword Health is the 26th fastest growing company in the US in this annual Inc. 5000 list!
    • >
  • We had our first profitable month in December 2023
    • >
  • and we just announced the world's first AI Care Specialist, Phoenix (video announcement here), which will support Bloom in the near future as well.
    • >


After just 9 sessions with Bloom, our menopausal women are reporting:

    >
  • 65% improvement on how their pelvic-health symptoms affect their lives
    • >
  • 67% decrease in the likelihood of seeking other healthcare interventions
    • >
  • For women who were already missing work, they reported a 71% reduction in work time missed
    • >
  • 50% reduction in severe depression symptoms
    • >
  • 53% reduction in severe anxiety symptoms
    • >


We all have 3 women in our lives we care deeply about, statistically, at least one of them is likely suffering from a pelvic health disorder. At Bloom, we're dedicated to breaking the silence around these common yet stigmatized issues. Let me know if you'd be open to a having a chat. It would be a pleasure to introduce myself and understand your career goals, what you've been working on at Humane, and possibly bounce this opportunity off of you if it makes sense.


PS - Job description linked here.


Hope to speak soon,

Amy

LinkedIn

>
> TF-MANAGED-396fa89a-74c9-4290-b7f0-eb1ff1f857f6 >
>

On Thu, Jun 6, 2024 at 9:15 AM Ally Rabon <allyrabonphoto@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Isa!! 

Hope you're doing well! Thank you so much for your patience while I've been getting everything lined up for you! 

Here's a little bit about how the associate photographer process works!

- My associate photographers are full time wedding photographers who have a very similar shooting style to me. I spend time with your photographer to make sure they understand the game plan for your day & understand what I am looking for from them! After they photograph your wedding day, all of the files are transferred over to me and I take it over from there! I edit all of the photos and send you your gallery! All of the communication will be done through me, but I make sure to connect the two of you so you will get to know each other as well! 

- With booking me through my associate photographer program I like to gift my couples a free engagement session (all you will have to pay for is travel fees) as a thank you!

Hi Isa,

On Jun 12, 2024, at 6:15 AM, Amy Wang Morales <a.wang@swordhealth.com> wrote:

>

Hi Isabelle,


My name is Amy and I'm with the Talent team here at Sword Health. We’re disrupting the $190B Physical Therapy market, and are backed by top investors like Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, and General Catalyst among others.


I'm reaching out because I love your experience at Humane and we are looking for a Head of Marketing to help us 10x our Women's Health product, Bloom (short video).


Bloom is our fastest growing product and was developed by Sword Health to connect millions of women with innovative pelvic health care from the comfort, convenience, and privacy of home under the belief that physical location should never limit access to clinical-grade care. Bloom includes customized guidance from Pelvic Health Specialists, the Bloom Pod by Elvie, and a mobile app to track real-time results and progress.


Here’s why someone would be excited to join Sword/Bloom now:

    >
  • We raised $400m in B/C/D rounds since 2020 (newest round raised this month)
    • >
  • Bloom has achieved 4.7x YoY growth. To put things in perspective, in January, Bloom alone generated as much revenue in one month as Sword did in the entire year of 2020.
    • >
  • Sword Health is the 26th fastest growing company in the US in this annual Inc. 5000 list!
    • >
  • We had our first profitable month in December 2023
    • >
  • and we just announced the world's first AI Care Specialist, Phoenix (video announcement here), which will support Bloom in the near future as well.
    • >


After just 9 sessions with Bloom, our menopausal women are reporting:

    >
  • 65% improvement on how their pelvic-health symptoms affect their lives
    • >
  • 67% decrease in the likelihood of seeking other healthcare interventions
    • >
  • For women who were already missing work, they reported a 71% reduction in work time missed
    • >
  • 50% reduction in severe depression symptoms
    • >
  • 53% reduction in severe anxiety symptoms
    • >


We all have 3 women in our lives we care deeply about, statistically, at least one of them is likely suffering from a pelvic health disorder. At Bloom, we're dedicated to breaking the silence around these common yet stigmatized issues. Let me know if you'd be open to a having a chat. It would be a pleasure to introduce myself and understand your career goals, what you've been working on at Humane, and possibly bounce this opportunity off of you if it makes sense.


PS - Job description linked here.


Hope to speak soon,

Amy

LinkedIn

>
> TF-MANAGED-396fa89a-74c9-4290-b7f0-eb1ff1f857f6 >
>

Amy Wang Morales

LOL and you wonder where Claire & I get it from 😂

On Mon, Jun 17, 2024 at 12:32 AM Vincent Leon <vleon@hawaii.edu> wrote:
Funny story about your stubborn daddy, from a studio art class, as recounted to me 40 yrs later by a freshman dormate. I exactly recall the sculpture he is talking about. It was a brown clay Edward Munch sort of existential hero, with very small ears that looked windblown backwards, and the teacher said I should fix the ears,  and I refused. Haha. Jackass me got a B+

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Eric Stein <ericsearsstein@gmail.com>
Date: Sun, Jun 16, 2024 at 7:23 PM
Subject: reunion
To: Ted Leon <vleon@hawaii.edu>


Hey Ted, it's Eric Stein.

I wanted to ask if you could resend the pictures of the old farts from Williams D? My wife didn't get them. If emailing doesn't work, perhaps texting them to her iphone might; if so, her number is 919-280-3952.

It was great to see you again after all of this time. I forgot to tell you that I'd actually told my wife about you before, not something I can say about many Williams people. I recounted a story I remember, we'll see how accurately, about you telling us second semester about your sculpture class. You had made a sculpture of someone's head as your final project. Your teacher told you it was a good sculpture but the ears were a little screwed up and that you'd get an A in the class if you fixed them. You thought the ears were just right and refused, so got a B+ instead. 

I came in freshman year with an inferiority complex from a southern public high school, so first semester I didn't care about grades. But other than getting killed in calculus I did pretty well and had definitely become a grade grubber by second semester. I remember how impressed I was with your artistic commitment and happy I wasn't presented with that choice! Not that I could have been because I would have needed some artistic ability, but you get the point.

I enjoyed my first reunion in the end, although I did get my first case of COVID there or on the trip back. We immediately headed to Berkeley for a wedding where we're now both quanantining at a friend's nice house who is out of town; there are worse places for sure. I hope your trip home was a little better.

Eric

On Jun 12, 2024, at 6:15 AM, Amy Wang Morales <a.wang@swordhealth.com> wrote:

﻿
>

Hi Isabelle,


My name is Amy and I'm with the Talent team here at Sword Health. We’re disrupting the $190B Physical Therapy market, and are backed by top investors like Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, and General Catalyst among others.


I'm reaching out because I love your experience at Humane and we are looking for a Head of Marketing to help us 10x our Women's Health product, Bloom (short video).


Bloom is our fastest growing product and was developed by Sword Health to connect millions of women with innovative pelvic health care from the comfort, convenience, and privacy of home under the belief that physical location should never limit access to clinical-grade care. Bloom includes customized guidance from Pelvic Health Specialists, the Bloom Pod by Elvie, and a mobile app to track real-time results and progress.


Here’s why someone would be excited to join Sword/Bloom now:

    >
  • We raised $400m in B/C/D rounds since 2020 (newest round raised this month)
    • >
  • Bloom has achieved 4.7x YoY growth. To put things in perspective, in January, Bloom alone generated as much revenue in one month as Sword did in the entire year of 2020.
    • >
  • Sword Health is the 26th fastest growing company in the US in this annual Inc. 5000 list!
    • >
  • We had our first profitable month in December 2023
    • >
  • and we just announced the world's first AI Care Specialist, Phoenix (video announcement here), which will support Bloom in the near future as well.
    • >


After just 9 sessions with Bloom, our menopausal women are reporting:

    >
  • 65% improvement on how their pelvic-health symptoms affect their lives
    • >
  • 67% decrease in the likelihood of seeking other healthcare interventions
    • >
  • For women who were already missing work, they reported a 71% reduction in work time missed
    • >
  • 50% reduction in severe depression symptoms
    • >
  • 53% reduction in severe anxiety symptoms
    • >


We all have 3 women in our lives we care deeply about, statistically, at least one of them is likely suffering from a pelvic health disorder. At Bloom, we're dedicated to breaking the silence around these common yet stigmatized issues. Let me know if you'd be open to a having a chat. It would be a pleasure to introduce myself and understand your career goals, what you've been working on at Humane, and possibly bounce this opportunity off of you if it makes sense.


PS - Job description linked here.


Hope to speak soon,

Amy

LinkedIn

A little more about Sword:- Video


>
> TF-MANAGED-396fa89a-74c9-4290-b7f0-eb1ff1f857f6 >
>


--

Amy Wang Morales

Senior Tech Talent Acquisition Partner| Sword Health

Subject:
=?utf-8?Q?Re:_Don=E2=80=99t_forget_to_have_children._Preferably_?=
 =?utf-8?Q?2!?=
Body:
Love you Dad! We’ll see - life is unpredictable! I’m just along for the ride :)

On Jun 15, 2024, at 12:08 PM, Vincent Leon <vleon@hawaii.edu> wrote:

﻿
I wouldn’t sweat the VP timeline. You gotta save some big professional challenges for your 50s and 60s. 

Plus you’ll be a way better VP - and I would argue a more courageous woman and accomplished leader of humans - after you have navigated the joys and challenges of early parenthood. 

I’m sure than Mom or I would come back to California to help. Better still, maybe by then I will have persuaded your mother that a 20
acre ranch with 3 separate dwellings, in North Kohala, is the perfect solution: You come for a few weeks, and then leave them for a few weeks with Mom and I. Summers and holidays in Hawi for a kid? What could be better than that!

Last but not least, you could get an international business posting for 3 yrs like Mom did, which comes with excellent travel, housing, educational and childcare benefits!

Those jobs pay for a generous home leave once a year and we would come visit you, wherever you were, several times a year, as well.
I’m thinking: Singapore, Tokyo, New Zealand or Australia, Geneva, Berlin, Barcelona, Argentina… any place that has new companies forming and growing, and in need of leadership, marketing, etc.

You know I’ve always been very fond of those executive MBA short courses, taken at three or four locations around the world. 

Think of specific technical skills you want to develop? And make it your life’s mission to improve your French, and pick up Spanish language skills. Learn about the world! It all sounds so good to me.



On Sat, Jun 15, 2024 at 6:21 AM Isabelle Rossi de Leon <isabelle.rossideleon@gmail.com> wrote:
Love you Dad! Don’t worry, we are planning on having kids one day, but just not soon! Koa is enough work 🐕 Plus, I want to make VP first 😇 

Will you come hang out in SF for a few months when we do have kids? It worries me that we don’t have help/family - besides Grandma Venta of course!

On Jun 14, 2024, at 10:20 PM, Vincent Leon <vleon@hawaii.edu> wrote:

﻿
Resend from June 11!

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Vincent Leon <vleon@hawaii.edu>
Date: Tue, Jun 11, 2024 at 9:24 AM
Subject: Don’t forget to have children. Preferably 2!
To: Claire Rossi de leon <clairerdl@gmail.com>, Isabelle Rossi de Leon <isabelle.rossideleon@gmail.com>


Mom and I get joy from our careers - and it’s important to have a sustainable professional career and a reliable source of income-  but there’s no comparison to the joy we get from being parents, and specifically from being YOUR parents. It totally enriches our life as human beings. 

You know how Penguin and Sunny and Koa make you happy? Having a human child is a similar feeling, only a thousand times more exciting and rewarding. 

You’ve got plenty of time to figure yourselves out and to “become who you are”. It all circles back to European and American existentialism, as greatly informed by the horrors of WWI and WWII, perhaps touched lightly by a bit of Zen Buddhism, dating back to the 1200’s!  

The sooner you can dive in and learn about Existentialism and Zen Buddhism, to simultaneously accept yourself and make the necessary, authentic, either/or choices of life, the sooner this life will make sense, and the sooner you will feel ready to produce children of your own. 

Please take the advice of a proud  🥹 papa like me; I’ve read about Zen Buddhism, and the subsequent giants of European Existentialism (Schopenhauer, Kierkegaard, Nietzsche, Sartre, DeBeavoir…), so I do my best to share tidbits with you two, relentlessly,  like “Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forwards”, or “we can choose what we DO, but we can’t choose what we WANT”, or “You always have a choice”. 

Even with a child in tow, your personal growth will happen in parallel. Just look at how my career and Mom‘s career have continued to grow even after Jan 3rd, 1995 and Feb 2nd 1997? We still traveled and worked and lived overseas, and managed to survive for over 20 years in Hawaii despite the high cost of living here. Simultaneously, mom has kept traveling (you were subjected to a lot of dad-prepared tofu and lentils!), and I did over a decade of international triathlons and marathon races, and spoke at some very interesting global health conferences, while dragging you kids joyfully around Europe and Asia. We bought beautiful condo in San Francisco and a beautiful home in Hawaii. We’ve funded our retirement. And we’re still in OK health, even if there is still plenty of room to improve our fitness. Having you kids did not slow us down; it just inspired us to work harder! 

When you are a young childless couple, “The Big 3” is “Sex, Money, and the In-laws”; Most early relationships break up due to fights and hurt feelings related to one of those elements 

Having children and raising children adds an important element of maturity. Gradually “The Big 3” morphs into “Health, Wealth, and Family”. And you just pray that the individual you have committed to is equally committed to generating and growing the H-W-F (health, wealth and family). 

Divorce, especially after children are in the mix, is usually an economic and emotional disaster for the children, and at least one of the parents. Sure, resilient people do it all the time, and often move on to happier and more successful 2nd and 3rd marriages, but if you can get it right the first time, it’s like “Contrabasi ALO!”…. So much sweeter!

For mom and I, it all came down to each of us having marketable skills to earn money, and choosing a partner that complemented our weaknesses, and shared our values, to create a whole that is greater than the sum of its parts. And it doesn’t hurt that I was gaga in love with your mother, the first time I ever saw her. 🤣. That’s the irrational and mystical part. 

Fact: If we hadn’t found a way to support ourselves economically, or if we had fought like animals and had a divorce,  we wouldn’t be living as well as we do. 

Summary: Don’t forget to have children!  Pregnancy is the world’s most fantastic science experiment, and nothing in the world beats the joy of parenting, and the joy of holidays and travel, with children! 

https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/10/opinion/natalism-liberalism-parenthood.html?unlocked_article_code=1.y00.OEZu.uiyfcboSRto6&smid=url-share

=?utf-8?Q?Re:_Don=E2=80=99t_forget_to_have_children._Preferably_?=

Body:
Love you Dad! Don’t worry, we are planning on having kids one day, but just not soon! Koa is enough work 🐕 Plus, I want to make VP first 😇 

Will you come hang out in SF for a few months when we do have kids? It worries me that we don’t have help/family - besides Grandma Venta of course!

On Thu, Jun 6, 2024 at 9:15 AM Ally Rabon <allyrabonphoto@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Isa!! 

Hope you're doing well! Thank you so much for your patience while I've been getting everything lined up for you! 

Here's a little bit about how the associate photographer process works!

- My associate photographers are full time wedding photographers who have a very similar shooting style to me. I spend time with your photographer to make sure they understand the game plan for your day & understand what I am looking for from them! After they photograph your wedding day, all of the files are transferred over to me and I take it over from there! I edit all of the photos and send you your gallery! All of the communication will be done through me, but I make sure to connect the two of you so you will get to know each other as well! 

- With booking me through my associate photographer program I like to gift my couples a free engagement session (all you will have to pay for is travel fees) as a thank you! 

- All film will be included free of charge! 

ALLY RABON PHOTO ASSOCIATE:
Below are a couple of galleries from your associate photographer, Sarah! Feel free to take a look through them and let me know what you think!

    • Talia & Teddy

    • Melanie & Anthony


I have attached an investment guide for you below! Let me know if you have any questions at all! 

Xx Ally

With this total service count on wedding day, there is no need for an additional artist, which will keep your total investment for beauty services lower. I know you’re only receiving this proposal today, but, transparently, I received a lead Wednesday afternoon for your wedding weekend. We’re in the thick of booking season for next year and leads are coming in regularly. That said, I want to give you an opportunity to review the proposal and consider my services for your wedding weekend before opening up the date to anyone else. If you’re able to review the proposal and make a decision over the weekend, it will give you an opportunity to secure the date for yourself before anyone else receives a proposal for their own event.

 

I require a signed contract and retainer payment to confirm a client’s event on my calendar. You can find both here and here. Subject: Re: Isabelle, we're hiring for a Head of Marketing for our Women's Health product (Series D, $400m+ raised)
Body:
Hi Amy,

Thanks for the note! I have a soft spot for women’s health - let’s chat! How does your Friday look?

Isa

On Jun 12, 2024, at 6:15 AM, Amy Wang Morales <a.wang@swordhealth.com> wrote:

﻿

Hi Isabelle,


My name is Amy and I'm with the Talent team here at Sword Health. We’re disrupting the $190B Physical Therapy market, and are backed by top investors like Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, and General Catalyst among others.


I'm reaching out because I love your experience at Humane and we are looking for a Head of Marketing to help us 10x our Women's Health product, Bloom (short video).


Bloom is our fastest growing product and was developed by Sword Health to connect millions of women with innovative pelvic health care from the comfort, convenience, and privacy of home under the belief that physical location should never limit access to clinical-grade care. Bloom includes customized guidance from Pelvic Health Specialists, the Bloom Pod by Elvie, and a mobile app to track real-time results and progress.


Here’s why someone would be excited to join Sword/Bloom now:

  • We raised $400m in B/C/D rounds since 2020 (newest round raised this month)
  • Bloom has achieved 4.7x YoY growth. To put things in perspective, in January, Bloom alone generated as much revenue in one month as Sword did in the entire year of 2020.
  • Sword Health is the 26th fastest growing company in the US in this annual Inc. 5000 list!
  • We had our first profitable month in December 2023
  • and we just announced the world's first AI Care Specialist, Phoenix (video announcement here), which will support Bloom in the near future as well.


After just 9 sessions with Bloom, our menopausal women are reporting:

  • 65% improvement on how their pelvic-health symptoms affect their lives
  • 67% decrease in the likelihood of seeking other healthcare interventions
  • For women who were already missing work, they reported a 71% reduction in work time missed
  • 50% reduction in severe depression symptoms
  • 53% reduction in severe anxiety symptoms


We all have 3 women in our lives we care deeply about, statistically, at least one of them is likely suffering from a pelvic health disorder. At Bloom, we're dedicated to breaking the silence around these common yet stigmatized issues. Let me know if you'd be open to a having a chat. It would be a pleasure to introduce myself and understand your career goals, what you've been working on at Humane, and possibly bounce this opportunity off of you if it makes sense.


PS - Job description linked here.


Hope to speak soon,

Amy

LinkedIn

A little more about Sword:- Video

On Tue, Jun 4, 2024 at 8:24 AM Margaret Snider <hello@margaretsniderco.com> wrote:

Good morning, Isabelle.

 

Thank you for reaching out about your bridal beauty services next June. I’m so excited to let you know I’m available and would be more than happy to send over a proposal for your wedding weekend.

 

There are a couple of pieces of information I’ll need to complete the proposal for you. Feel free to respond via email- I’m also happy to hop on a call if you want to talk through things together. I have availability this afternoon 3pm-5pm est or tomorrow from 1pm-2:30pm.

 

  • Where are you based?
  • Who are you considering for photo? (Feel free to include anyone you’re considering.)
  • Who are you considering for a planner? (Feel free to include anyone you’re considering.)
  • Are you interested in booking services for a welcome dinner/rehearsal the day before or only for wedding day services?
  • How many makeup services on wedding day, excluding yours, would you like included on the proposal?
  • How many hairstyling services on wedding day, excluding yours, would you like included on the proposal?

 

Looking forward to hearing from you!

 

 

Best,

 

Margaret Snider
Owner | Principal Artist at Margaret Snider & Co

E  hello@margaretsniderco.com

 

W  margaretsniderco.com

Office hours Tues-Fri 10 am - 5 pm

 

 

Please allow 24 hours for a response. Messages received after 2 pm on Friday will not be answered until the follow Tuesday. Thank you for your patience.

 

Upcoming out of office dates: May 27th-May 30th

Let me know if you have > any questions at all! > > Xx Ally > > -- > >
Hi! Thanks so much for getting back to me. These photos are beautiful, but feel a lot more "traditional wedding" than what I've seen from you, but let me know if I'm missing something! I also definitely want some film photography.

On Thu, Jun 6, 2024 at 9:15 AM Ally Rabon <allyrabonphoto@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi Isa!! 

Hope you're doing well! Thank you so much for your patience while I've been getting everything lined up for you! 

Here's a little bit about how the associate photographer process works!

- My associate photographers are full time wedding photographers who have a very similar shooting style to me. I spend time with your photographer to make sure they understand the game plan for your day & understand what I am looking for from them! After they photograph your wedding day, all of the files are transferred over to me and I take it over from there! I edit all of the photos and send you your gallery! All of the communication will be done through me, but I make sure to connect the two of you so you will get to know each other as well! 

- With booking me through my associate photographer program I like to gift my couples a free engagement session (all you will have to pay for is travel fees) as a thank you! 

- All film will be included free of charge! 

ALLY RABON PHOTO ASSOCIATE:
Below are a couple of galleries from your associate photographer, Sarah! Feel free to take a look through them and let me know what you think!

    • Talia & Teddy

    • Melanie & Anthony


I have attached an investment guide for you below! Let me know if you have any questions at all! 

Xx Ally

--

Hi! Amazing! Good luck with the events this week, and no rush.

Answers here:
  • Partner's name: Nic Baird
  • Budget: 5k max
  • Planner, if applicable: We’ll have a day of coordinator, but otherwise I will be the main point of contact
  • Photographer: Working on it, but hoping for an editorial + documentary approach on film
  • Ceremony design: Outdoors overlooking the ocean, couple to stand, considering guest chairs in more of a circle or otherwise getting creative - we’re not traditional!
  • Wedding party size: No formal wedding party, 50 total guests
  • Cocktail hour/ reception design: Outdoors overlooking the ocean with some high and low tables. Reception indoors in The Solarium overlooking the sunset with all glass walls. Long L shaped table and 2 additional long tables.
  • Color palette and and Pinterest links or inspirational images: We haven’t picked colors yet and would love to collaborate with you to highlight the natural beauty of Sea Ranch with florals. I absolutely love your whimsical + architectural style, and I’m excited to pick flowers together. 
Warmly,
Isa

On May 27, 2024, at 8:46 AM, Linzy Griswold <hello@formandflower.com> wrote:

﻿
Hi Isabelle,

Thank you for your inquiry and congratulations to you and your partner!  We are currently available on 6/7/25 and would love to hear a bit more and prepare a customized floral proposal for you.  Sea Ranch is a personal favorite destination; what a great choice for your wedding!

Please let me know a bit more about your event including:
  • Partner's name
  • Budget
  • Planner, if applicable
  • Photographer
  • Ceremony design
  • Wedding party size
  • Cocktail hour/ reception design 
  • Color palette and and Pinterest links or inspirational images
Thank you and I look forward to hearing from you!  Note we have multiple events this week so the proposal will be a week or so out from when I hear back from you.  Hope you are having a great holiday weekend!

Best,
Linzy

Form & Flower
415.203.2743
formandflower.com
@linzygriswold

Subject: Fwd: New proposal: Pricing Guide - Laurken Kendall Photo
Body:
---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Laurken Kendall Date: Sun, Jun 2, 2024 at 8:13 AM Subject: New proposal: Pricing Guide - Laurken Kendall Photo To: Isabelle Rossi de Leon Hey , I am beyond honored that my work resonates with you. My couples and I spend a lot of time getting to know each other via face time and what can only be described as ALL the texting. I am not only here as your resource and to hold your hand through the wedding planning process (and literally on the day of), but also as your human Xanax, your bulldog and a place for you to bare your true self as we walk this part of your life together. Photography is nothing if not personal, and the relationship I have with my couples is imperative to my process. I am sending along my wedding photography brochure. It's customizable and you can add hours, now or as we get closer if you decide you need more, although it is very very rare for people to need more coverage; 90% of what you saw on my blog are 9-hour days. Each package includes the documentation and full resolution downloads from a secure and private digital gallery. Travel of roundtrip airfare from Spokane, WA + 2 nights stay will be billed separately (3 months prior for domestic and 6 months for international). If you have somewhere you'd like to put me up for your wedding with a private room and bath, I am all ears and would love to discuss it with you prior to confirming my stay. If required, a rental car or shuttle (mostly Mexico) will also be billed separately. If your wedding is within the state of Washington or drivable distance < 6 hours, mileage of $1 mile/one way will be billed in addition to two nights stay+ $200 travel fee. Know going in that email is the bane of my existence and text is how I communicate. If you have questions or want to schedule a FaceTime, my phone number is 509-288-0615. Here if you need me, always. Yours, Laurken Pricing Guide [image: pixel]

On Mon, Jun 3, 2024 at 9:29 AM Whimsy! <katie@whimsybridal.com> wrote:
Hi Isabelle,

Thank you so much for reaching out. I am available June 7th, 25. Sea Ranch is (on paper) an hour and forty minutes from me however, because we work there a lot I know I actually have to give two hours of travel time to get there. It's not a problem for me but it does make the travel fee $240 per stylist. If it stays under 7 services, hair being one service and makeup being a second I would be the only stylist. If it's 8 or more we would need an additional stylist for up to 14 services. I just like to point that out before we get too into the conversation as it often doesn't fit into some brides' plans/budgets. If that works for you and your group, check out my website: www.whimsybridal.com for more detailed pricing and my portfolio. There is also a contact page on the site. Once you fill that out and submit it it will get the ball rolling. 

Best Regards,
Katie Donaghy

On Mon, Jun 3, 2024 at 1:05 PM James Guzzi <jamie@ceremonydjs.com> wrote:
Hey Isabelle,

So it sounds like we're moving forward with this?  That's great news!   I can already tell it's going to be really good. ; )

Ok, here are the next steps.

First, you’ll want to eSign the contract. To do that, you want to look for an email from a website called RocketLawyer, which should be there momentarily.

Second, you’ll want to submit the retainer via your favorite online payment app. PayPal: jguzzi@hotmail.com; SquareCash: $JamesGuzzi; or Venmo: @James-Guzzi.

Once that’s all in, we’re good to schedule the first creative meeting as soon as you like! Usually we do a weekday evening around 6:00 via Zoom.

Any chance Tuesday, 7/9 @ 6:00 works for everyone?  That’s our next available slot.

Glad this all worked out! 

J

On Sun, May 26, 2024 at 8:30 AM Melissa Habegger <melissa@melissahabegger.com> wrote:
Hi Isabelle & Nic,

So happy to hear you - and so grateful that you found my work and that it resonates with you. I am absolutely available on June 7, 2025 and I would love to join you two and your people as you celebrate at Sea Ranch. What a special slice of land to root your marriage in - and an absurdly beautiful place for a party.

A little bit about me that I'm sure you picked up in my portfolio but I'll say it out loud anyway  - my hope is for you two to end up with photographs that you really recognize yourselves in; that you and your family and friends feel reflected honestly and with love and joy and humor. I try to capture the day in a way that gives you the time and space to spend real, quality time with your people - we'll take meaningful portraits, of course, but everything is done with that philosophy in mind.

My pricing starts at $8,000 (this includes eight hours of coverage) and I shoot primarily digital with a little bit of film. I like to be flexible with my offerings from there - we can chat more about your hopes for photography and ideal spend, and come up with a custom package that meets your needs.

If that all aligns, I'd love to connect! Let me know if there's a time below that works for you and I'll send over a google video invite. 

Monday 5/27: 2pm-4pm
Tuesday 5/28: 7pm-9pm
Wednesday 5/29: 9am-11am, 1pm-4pm, 8pm-9pm
Monday 6/3: 9am-9pm

And of course, let me know if you have any quick questions. Looking forward to meeting you!

xo
Melissa
(914) 263-0890

--

On May 28, 2024, at 1:36 PM, Megan Goetz <megangoetzphoto@gmail.com> wrote:

﻿ YOUR GETTING MARRIED!!!!!
You have a new message in Isabelle Rossi de Leon's Project from Megan Goetz

Hello Isabelle!!!

 

Congrats on getting engaged and planning a wedding!!!! Thanks so much for taking the time to fill out my inquiry form! Your wedding sounds like an absolute dream. I'm in love with Sea Ranch and I've been dying to photograph a wedding at the Sea Ranch Lodge!! 

 

I'm so stoked I have June 7th, 2025 available and I'd love to get to know you both a bit more! Connecting with people is my favorite part about this job, so I'd love to start by setting up a Zoom call to chat with the two of you and hear about your wedding visions and priorities!! You can schedule a call with me here :) It's super important to me that we all vibe well together because I create my best work when I connect with the people on the other side of the camera. 

 

I always like to tell my couples that all of my wedding packages can always be customized in order to fit your needs! Every couple and every wedding is uniquely different and I want my packages to reflect that, so don't hesitate to ask me any questions that may come up! I'm here to help you with whatever you need!!! 

 

Attached is my price guide. There's a ton information on process and packages, it goes over a lot of questions! :) 

 

So excited to connect! Can't wait to hear more from you two!! 

 

Best,

Meg

 

she/her/hers

Megan Goetz Photography LLC
megangoetzphotography.com
(530) 401-6117

Subject: Re: Humane Help
Body:
Thanks for the note! We are in the process of fundraising and there’s a lot of speculation. Don’t worry too much about it. Not ready to start spending quite yet but the Q3 forecast is meaningful, so I’ll be knocking on your door as soon as I get the go ahead on budget!

Isa

﻿
Hey Isa,

How are things going? I just got back from a nice little Spanish vacation and I wanted to check in. I saw some news about Humane potentially being up for sale? Any info would be appreciated!

Best,
Owen

Thank you! Ping me if you don’t hear back.

On Apr 22, 2024, at 8:42 AM, Owen Loft <owen@sociummedia.com> wrote:

﻿
Sounds good! I'm waiting to hear back from Alex on scheduling, but it doesn't sound like it needs to happen ASAP. We have most of our info together and are happy to present as soon as mid to EOW. I'll follow up with him tomorrow if I don't hear anything. We're excited to potentially partner! I think it could be a really fun one.

On Fri, Apr 19, 2024 at 8:44 PM Isabelle Rossi de Leon <isabelle.rossideleon@gmail.com> wrote:
Thanks so much for the note. I'll give you the full update on our next call, but things are actually looking surprisingly ok on a bunch of levels here.

We are pausing all paid media short term, so the work we'll do together will start in a couple weeks instead of immediately, but I'd still love to keep the ball rolling so we're ready when the time comes.

Isa

On Thu, Apr 18, 2024 at 2:34 PM Owen Loft <owen@sociummedia.com> wrote:
Hey Isa,

I wanted to check in separately and see if there are any other ways in which I could help with Humane, specifically in the form of intros. It looks like it's been a pretty tough news week, sadly.

The main 2 areas that come to mind are:
  • Community management - replying to, hiding, and/or deleting social post comments, and also blocking repeat offenders from viewing any posts from the page. There are companies that handle this and can take the strain of the internal team. This will be even more important after paid ads ramp back up.
  • PR - I'd be happy to ask around for recommendations to good firms if you're interested. Our new biz dev guy mentioned a PR pro at a VC firm he knows that I could try to get in touch with.
Outside of that, it's a first of its kind product that needs a little polishing, but is very cool nonetheless. We're definitely still interested in working together and our team is looking through the accounts and preparing the proposal. Let me know if you think there's anything specific we should include that the Humane team would want to see.

Best,
Owen

Subject: Fwd: Even More LVMH Intrigue, W’s Mini-Moment & Sephora Sales Wars

﻿


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Lauren Sherman <lauren@puck.news>
Date: May 29, 2024 at 5:45:03 PM
Subject: Even More LVMH Intrigue, W’s Mini-Moment & Sephora Sales Wars
To: adam@thedailyswarm.com


Hi, and welcome back to Line Sheet. Today, my partner Rachel Strugatz has news and notes on a Sephora battle, plus the data behind a Glossier relaunch. ’ve also got an incremental update on the enigmatic LVMH executive shuffle—things are getting peculiar on Avenue Montaigne—and some positive stats from the legacy media annals via Sara Moonves’ W magazine and Bryan Goldberg’s BDG.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 

Hi, and welcome back to Line Sheet. I had dinner at the Tower Bar last night with an old friend from New York. Is there nothing better?

Today, my partner Rachel Strugatz has news and notes on a Sephora battle, plus the data behind a Glossier relaunch. (As always, email her tips at Rachel@puck.news.) I’ve also got an incremental update on the enigmatic LVMH executive shuffle—things are getting peculiar on Avenue Montaigne—and some positive stats from the legacy media annals via Sara Moonves’s W magazine and Bryan Goldberg’s BDG.

Also, don’t forget to check out the latest episode of Fashion People: Style Not Com’s Beka Gvishiani and I talked Louis Vuitton Cruise, Cannes best- (and worst-) dressed, the indie designer crisis, and our dream picks for the next round of designer musical chairs.

By the way, I hope that I will see you on Monday, June 3, at 7 p.m. at the Roosevelt Hotel. I’ll be holding court with the top costume designers from five HBO and Max Originals shows. We’ll have a conversation amongst ourselves, and then I’ll stick around to have a conversation with you, too. RSVP right here.

Mentioned in this issue: Sol de Janeiro, Rare Beauty, Balm Dotcom, Reddit, Bernard Arnault, Serge Brunschwig, Michael Burke, Delphine Arnault, Louis Vuitton, W magazine, Sephora, Bryan Goldberg, Bustle Digital Group, Sara Moonves, Karlie Kloss, Beyoncé, Cowboy Carter, Selena Gomez, and more.
A MESSAGE FROM OUR SPONSOR

For Your Emmy® Consideration
Outstanding Television Movie

-

[WATCH] Rufus Sewell Transforms into Prince Andrew
Rufus Sewell guides us through the process of transforming into Prince Andrew in Scoop.
Inspired by real events, this fictional dramatization gives an insider account of how the women of Newsnight secured Prince Andrew’s infamous interview.

-

For more on Scoop, visit series.netflixawards.com
  • Serge? Really?: By all accounts, outgoing Fendi C.E.O. Serge Brunschwig is a smart guy. Like his boss, LVMH chairman and C.E.O. Bernard Arnault, he was educated at École Polytechnique, France’s famous engineering school. (Only one Arnault heir, Frédéric, can boast the same.) But is Brunschwig, who has worked for the family firm since 1995, really dynamic enough to oversee the LVMH fashion group? Nevertheless, the behind-the-scenes operator is now rumored to be replacing Michael Burke, who mysteriously stepped back as C.E.O. of the group after only four months in the role. Meanwhile, Burke’s deputy Pierre-Emmanuel Angeloglou is apparently taking over for Brunschwig at Fendi.

    A person who knows each of the players well suggested that this isn’t how the game of musical chairs will end, and I tend to agree. The chief executive of the fashion group isn’t just a vast job that requires overseeing the executive team, managing brands, recruiting designers, and managing up to Arnault. It’s also traditionally been a big personality job. Burke and his predecessors, Sidney Toledano and Pierre-Yves Roussel, were three of Arnault’s most public-facing, iconoclastic deputies. They all made big moves that changed the company, from hiring Phoebe Philo in 2008 to bringing Hedi Slimane aboard in 2018.

    And yet, Brunschwig’s operational bearing may be a representation of the changing times within the Arnault family and their heirloom. All those consiglieri of Bernard’s generation—Toledano, Toni Belloni, Burke—are beginning to recede into the background while the kids, as insiders like to call the five Arnault heirs, grow into their stations and assert their power. Today, leading the fashion group is more of a chairman role.

    I talked to more insiders about what might be happening with Burke, and the narrative is pretty much the same across the board. There may be some personal stuff, and a company like this will do everything in its power to protect the privacy and wishes of a 38-year veteran. So the enigma may remain, but what’s clear is that Burke ran Louis Vuitton the way he wanted to run it for the past decade, while simultaneously training eldest child Delphine Arnault—who worked under him at the brand—on how to do his job. Now she’s doing that job as C.E.O. of Dior, the second-largest fashion business in the company. Meanwhile, she and her brother Alexandre, the middle child, have more influence over their father than ever. Whether or not Brunschwig gets the fashion group C.E.O. job is almost an afterthought compared to all the musical chairs yet to come...

  • Hey, guess what, W magazine is not failing!: Before it was the type of thing collected by art directors, W was a broadsheet supplement in the spectacularly trashy Women’s Wear Daily. Several iterations later, it’s a joint venture between Bryan Goldberg’s Bustle Digital Group and a consortium of investors (including Karlie Kloss), led by editor-in-chief Sara Moonves. People were skeptical when Moonves, a recovering Voguette with a famous last name (Les is her dad), took over from Stefano Tonchi (a story for another day). But Moonves has done a good job—with styling, photography, and overall vision—in an era when most magazines are utter trash. And this week, she offered a throwback to W’s broadsheet roots by releasing the digital Beyoncé cover physically through a limited print edition at Iconic magazines in SoHo and at the Air Mail store in the West Village.

    This was a clever way to turn the Beyoncé cover—published digitally for a variety of reasons, but mostly because the Cowboy Carter album release was not in sync with W’s print schedule—into a collector’s item that advertisers would be more than willing to support. The magazine’s internal stats suggest that the online version garnered more than 3.5 billion press impressions—I can’t even begin to decipher what that means or the number of abacuses that they used—and 348 million social media impressions. Apparently, print is working for W, whose circulation is up 21 percent in the first half of the year. Overall revenue (including digital and experiential products) is projected to be up by double digits, too. Moonves and Goldberg have not only managed to upsell traditional luxury advertisers, but also draw new entrants in prestige auto, hard luxury, and fashion.

    Among the reasons for skepticism of the BDG deal, back in the summer of 2020, was that Moonves was essentially unproven, the business was not clearly worth saving, and Goldberg cosplays as an insecure rich guy. But she has given him exactly what he needed: a foothold in luxury, especially important now as brands allocate their shrinking budgets away from digital banner ads. All I heard at the shows last season was that luxury brands want print, print, print, and they want print that they’re excited to read.

    Advertising hasn’t been easy for BDG over the past couple of years. Goldberg & Co. started babbling about events as the answer, and lost chief revenue officer Jason Wagenheim (Teen Vogue Forever) at the end of 2023. But since W is run slightly apart from the rest of the portfolio, and because it’s luxury, an opportunity remained. Now, BDG is benefiting more broadly from the demand for print, and relaunching Nylon as well. (Also, the group publishes a decent amount of good work via publications like The Romper and Bustle, I swear. It’s not the content farm it used to be.) Anyway, that concludes my rant on why you should be jealous of W.
Sephora Wars & Glossier’s Balm Drama
News and notes on the latest intrigue consuming beauty insiders: Sol de Janeiro leapfrogging Rare Beauty at Sephora and Glossier’s Balm Dotcom pivot.
RACHEL STRUGATZ
As it turns out, Selena Gomez’s Rare Beauty may have bigger things to worry about than its impending blush war with pseudo-rival Hailey Bieber. Following last week’s Line Sheet dispatch, a handful of very in-the-know people reached out to tell me that Rare Beauty is no longer on track to be Sephora’s number one brand. That highly sought-after distinction now belongs to Heela Yang’s Sol de Janeiro, whose Brazilian Bum Bum cream and gourmand body splashes helped make it Sephora’s best-selling brand in January, February, and March of this year. In April, it was runner-up to the retailer’s private label Sephora brand, which accounts for a shockingly large part of its business.

The contest isn’t particularly close, either. According to YipitData, Sol de Janeiro’s Sephora sales in the U.S. are approaching $120 million year-to-date. (That’s retail sales, not revenue. Brands typically split their revenue with Sephora, although the retailer’s cut varies; Glossier, I’m told, gets a better margin than less desirable brands.) Rare, meanwhile, sold about $82 million through Sephora in the U.S. during the same period. That’s still impressive: Barbara Sturm’s skincare line, according to a confidential brand deck that I viewed, didn’t hit its projected net sales of $83.5 million in 2023, the year it was acquired.
A MESSAGE FROM OUR SPONSOR

For Your Emmy® Consideration
Outstanding Television Movie

-

[WATCH] Rufus Sewell Transforms into Prince Andrew
Rufus Sewell guides us through the process of transforming into Prince Andrew in Scoop.
Inspired by real events, this fictional dramatization gives an insider account of how the women of Newsnight secured Prince Andrew’s infamous interview.

-

For more on Scoop, visit series.netflixawards.com
Sol de Janeiro’s trajectory has been fascinating. Nearly a decade after Yang launched the brand with three products, the line has single-handedly reinvigorated a niche within a wider fragrance category. Sol de Janeiro’s success has buoyed the entire body splash category, even boosting mall favorite body splash maker Bath & Body Works, which has seen a remarkable lift as a result. According to a millennial friend who speaks Gen Z, “the pink one” from Sol de Janeiro, a Baccarat Rouge dupe, smells the best.
Glossier’s Balm Bomb
Speaking of Gen Z favorites, Glossier is finally recovering after its botched vegan reformulation of their popular Balm Dotcom last year. Apparently, the sheep’s wool-derived synthetic lanolin and beeswax-free formula didn’t live up to its predecessor. Some claimed it made their lips even drier. Long story short, everyone hated Balm Dotcom 2.0, and I’m told that within months, the brand realized it had to bring the original back. “The comments about how bad it was never stopped,” said a person close to the business.

Correcting the mistake was imperative for Glossier. Since its launch, way back in 2014, Balm Dotcom has been a top seller thanks to some very clever branding of what is ultimately a pretty mediocre salve. And preserving its most important franchises is a priority for Glossier, especially as it explores a potential sale in which Thrive, Forerunner, Index, and Sequoia expect a return on their collective $266 million investment. Alas, the Balm Dotcom misfire came at an inopportune time in Glossier’s lifecycle: It had just kicked off a major brand reset, which included a Sephora rollout and the splashy reopening of a SoHo flagship—some of the first public-facing initiatives under still-newish C.E.O. Kyle Leahy.
Anyway, about two weeks ago, Glossier reintroduced the old, lanolin-packed Balm Dotcom in eight flavors (a new strawberry flavor came out in late April) with a very un-Glossier video that featured employees reading some of the more outrageous Reddit commentary over the last year. In many ways, it was refreshing to see a brand that’s usually so precious poke fun at itself. While I’ve heard that initial sales of Balm Dotcom didn’t live up to Glossier’s extremely high internal goal, by almost any measure the relaunch was a success. According to YipitData, sales on Glossier’s site during the relaunch reached about $2.5 million per week, well above the typical $1.5 million that the product was generating online.

There’s a lesson in all this, perhaps, for beauty companies looking to align their products with younger millennials and Gen Zers, who demands that their makeup and skincare products mirror their values. Brands need to be vegan and cruelty-free, but the products still need to work—and, importantly, can’t be noticeably poorer than their non-vegan predecessors. Anyway, for all you ethical consumers out there, you can still find some pre-reformulated Balm Dotcoms on Glossier’s site for 50 percent off.
That’s it from Rachel and me. By the way, did you see that the Zac Posen x Gap white shirt dress sold out? Is it destined to be the dress of the summer, the 2024 version of Calypso St. Barth’s Pazzi? (#Neverforget.) Depends on how many they made, I guess.

Until tomorrow,
Lauren
FOUR STORIES WE’RE TALKING ABOUT

Warmly,
Isa

Don't take the coyotes lightly.    I suspect coyote den has pups,  and would mean even more coyotes.  I think at this point they should possibly be relocated to another park such as McLaren or San Bruno Mountain.
